returnValue: The value is a slash ("/") for UNIX, and a backslash ("\") for the Windows operating systems.

name: path.directory
syntax: function string path.directory (const string path [, long os.type])
description: Returns the directory information for the specified path string.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: the path of a file or a directory

arguments.name: os.type ]
arguments.description: when specified, the path is interpreted according to the given OS type; specify one of the following values: OS_WINDOWS_NT , OS_UNIX

returnValue: Directory information for path, or an empty string if path denotes a root directory or is empty, or if path does not contain directory information.

name: path.exists
syntax: function boolean path.exists (const string path [, long access_level])
description: This function returns true if the given path exists, and false otherwise. If the current BSE is a tenant BSE, path is always interpreted as a relative path.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The file or directory to check.

arguments.name: access_level ]
arguments.description: Optional, determines how to interpret the path if the current BSE is a tenant BSE: PATH_USER_LEVEL

returnValue: True if the file or directory exists, false otherwise

name: path.extension
syntax: function string path.extension (const string path [, long os.type])
description: Returns the extension of the specified path string.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: the path string from which to get the extension

arguments.name: os.type ]
arguments.description: when specified, the path is interpreted according to the given OS type; specify one of the following values: OS_WINDOWS_NT , OS_UNIX

returnValue: The extension of the specified path (including the period "."), or an empty string. If path is an empty string, or if path does not have extension information, this function returns an empty string.

name: path.filename
syntax: function string path.filename (const string path [, long os.type])
description: Returns the filename and extension of the specified path string.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: the path string from which to obtain the filename and the extension

arguments.name: os.type ]
arguments.description: when specified, the path is interpreted according to the given OS type; specify one of the following values: OS_WINDOWS_NT , OS_UNIX

returnValue: The characters after the last directory character in path. If the last character of path is a directory or volume separator character, this method returns an empty string. If path is an empty string, this function returns an empty string as well.

name: path.filename.without.extension
syntax: function string path.filename.without.extension (const string path [, long os.type])
description: Returns the filename of the specified path string without the extension.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: the path string of the file

arguments.name: os.type ]
arguments.description: when specified, the path is interpreted according to the given OS type; specify one of the following values: OS_WINDOWS_NT , OS_UNIX

returnValue: The string returned by path.filename() , minus the last period (.) and all characters following it.

name: path.has.extension
syntax: function boolean path.has.extension (const string path [, long os.type])
description: Determines whether a path string includes a file name extension.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: the path string to search for an extension

arguments.name: os.type ]
arguments.description: when specified, the path is interpreted according to the given OS type; specify one of the following values: OS_WINDOWS_NT , OS_UNIX

returnValue: true if the characters that follow the last directory separator (\ or /) in the path include a period (.) followed by one or more characters; otherwise, false.

name: path.is.absolute
description: This checks if path_name is an absolute path.

arguments.name: path_name
arguments.description: Path name.

name: path.separator
description: Returns a platform-specific separator character (":" or ";") used to separate path strings in environment variables.

arguments.name: os.type ]
arguments.description: when specified, the separator returned is the one for the given OS type; specify one of the following values: OS_WINDOWS_NT , OS_UNIX

returnValue: On Windows-based platforms, the value returned is the semicolon (;). On Unix platforms the value returned is the colon (:).

name: pathname
syntax: function long pathname (string file_basename, string file_type, ref string file_path [, long log.options])
description: This searches for and returns the location of a specified file.

name: pc$
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.activate.session
syntax: function long pcm.activate.session (ref string session, string title)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: session
arguments.description: The session code.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: The title for the session window.

returnValue: The function returns the process ID of the activated session.

name: pcm.change
syntax: function void pcm.change (long plan_id, ..., long flag, long value)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: plan_id, ...
arguments.description: The ID of the chart whose attributes you want to change, as returned by pcm.create() .

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: Use these arguments to set new values for the chart attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmPlanName or PcmPlanBackgroundColor), and the attribute value. For a list of the plan attributes, see pcm.create() .

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Use these arguments to set new values for the chart attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmPlanName or PcmPlanBackgroundColor), and the attribute value. For a list of the plan attributes, see pcm.create() .

name: pcm.change.object
syntax: function void pcm.change.object (long plan_id, long object_id [, long flag] [, long value,])
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: plan_id
arguments.description: The ID of the chart to which the object belongs, as returned by pcm.create() .

arguments.name: object_id
arguments.description: The ID of the object, as returned by pcm.create.object() .

arguments.name: flag ]
arguments.description: Use these arguments to set new values for the object's attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmMenuName or PcmTimescaleVisible), and the attribute value. For a list of the object attributes, see pcm.create.object() .

arguments.name: value, ]
arguments.description: Use these arguments to set new values for the object's attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmMenuName or PcmTimescaleVisible), and the attribute value. For a list of the object attributes, see pcm.create.object() .

name: pcm.create
syntax: function long pcm.create ( [long flag] [, long value,...])
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: flag ]
arguments.description: Use this optional argument to specify the read mode for seq.gets(). Possible values are: PcmPlanName(50) (string) The title of the chart.

returnValue: The function returns a unique ID for the new chart.

name: pcm.create.object
syntax: function long pcm.create.object (long plan_id, long object_type [, long flag] [, long value] [, long flag, value])
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: plan_id
arguments.description: The ID of the plan to which you want to add the new object.

arguments.name: object_type
arguments.description: The object type. The possible values are: PCM_OT_MENU - menu object a menu item PCM_OT_BUTTON � button object a button to which you can link sessions or options PCM_OT_TIMESCALE � time scale object a time scale PCM_OT_DELAY � delay time object delay time (that is, non workdays) PCM_OT_COLUMN � column object a column containing an activity description PCM_OT_ACTIVITY � activity object an activity PCM_OT_RELATION � relation object a relation PCM_OT_MARKER � marker object an activity marker

arguments.name: flag ]
arguments.description: Use these arguments to define the object's attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmMenuName or PcmTimescaleVisible), and the attribute value. The attributes of each object are listed in the section describing that object.

arguments.name: value ]
arguments.description: Use these arguments to define the object's attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmMenuName or PcmTimescaleVisible), and the attribute value. The attributes of each object are listed in the section describing that object.

arguments.name: flag, value ]
arguments.description: Use these arguments to define the object's attributes. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, PcmMenuName or PcmTimescaleVisible), and the attribute value. The attributes of each object are listed in the section describing that object.

returnValue: The function returns a unique ID for the new object.

name: pcm.destroy
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.destroy.object
syntax: function void pcm.destroy.object (long plan_id, long object_id)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: plan_id
arguments.description: The ID of the chart to which the object belongs, as returned by pcm.create() .

arguments.name: object_id
arguments.description: The ID of the object, as returned by pcm.create.object() .

name: pcm.get.data
syntax: function void pcm.get.data (long evt_type, ref string arglist,...)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: evt_type
arguments.description: This specifies the type of the event you want to read.

arguments.name: arglist,...
arguments.description: This returns the argument list.

name: pcm.lock
syntax: function void pcm.lock (long plan_id, long lock)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: plan_id
arguments.description: The ID of the planning chart that you want to lock.

arguments.name: lock
arguments.description: This indicates whether the planning chart must be locked or unlocked. The possible values are: true The planning board is locked. The user cannot interact with it until it is unlocked again. false The planning board is unlocked. This is the default value.

name: pcm.refresh
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pcm.send.bms.event
syntax: function void pcm.send.bms.event (long command, ref string arglist)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: command
arguments.description: The command to be sent back to the application. The Chart Manager places this in the variable

arguments.name: arglist
arguments.description: The argument list. The application can retrieve this string by calling bms.receive$() .

name: pf$
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for character-based windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: pipe.clearerr
description: This resets the error and end-of-file indicators on the specified pipe.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: pipe.close
description: This clears any buffers associated with the specified pipe and closes the file. Buffers allocated by the standard input/output system are also cleared. Note that pipe.close() is performed automatically when the process exits.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: pipe.eof
description: This checks the end-of-file indicator on the specified pipe. Note that the end-of-file indicator lasts until the pipe is closed, unless you explicitly clear it by calling pipe.clearerr() .

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

returnValue: <>0 end-of-file indicator read on specified pipe

name: pipe.error
description: This checks the error indicator on the specified pipe to determine whether an error has occurred when reading or writing to the pipe. Note that the error indicator lasts until the pipe is closed, unless you explicitly clear it by calling pipe.clearerr() .

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

returnValue: <>0 error has occurred when reading or writing to the pipe

name: pipe.flush
description: This writes any buffered data associated with a pipe to the related file. The stream remains open.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: pipe.gets
syntax: function long pipe.gets (ref string line, long nr_of_bytes, long pipe_id)
description: This reads a maximum of one line from the specified pipe.

arguments.name: line
arguments.description: This stores the characters read from the pipe.

arguments.name: nr_of_bytes
arguments.description: This specifies the maximum number of bytes to be read from the pipe. The function stops reading when it encounters a newline character or when it has read the number of bytes specified by this argument, whichever comes first.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: pipe.open
syntax: function long pipe.open (string pathnm, string openmode)
description: This creates a UNIX process with the specified name and links an input and/or output stream to it. It returns a pointer to the pipe; this is used to identify the pipe in subsequent operations.

arguments.name: pathnm
arguments.description: The path name for the UNIX process.

arguments.name: openmode
arguments.description: Use this to specify whether the pipe is opened for reading, writing, or both. The possible values are: "r" create for reading "w" create for writing "rw" create for reading and writing

returnValue: >=1 success; a pointer to the pipe is returned

name: pipe.puts
syntax: function long pipe.puts (string line, long pipe_id)
description: This writes data to the specified pipe. It automatically appends a newline character to the data.

arguments.name: line
arguments.description: The data to be written to the pipe.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: pipe.read
syntax: function long pipe.read (ref string buffer, long nr_of_bytes, long pipe_id)
description: This reads a specified number of bytes from the specified pipe.

arguments.name: buffer
arguments.description: This stores the characters read from the pipe.

arguments.name: nr_of_bytes
arguments.description: This specifies the maximum number of bytes to be read from the pipe. The function stops reading when it has read the number of bytes specified by this argument or when it reaches the end of the file, whichever comes first.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: pipe.write
syntax: function long pipe.write (string buffer, long nr_of_bytes, long pipe_id)
description: This appends a specified number of bytes to the specified pipe.

arguments.name: buffer
arguments.description: This stores the characters that must be written to the pipe.

arguments.name: nr_of_bytes
arguments.description: This specifies the maximum number of bytes to be written to the pipe. The function stops writing to the pipe when it has written this number of bytes or when it reaches the end of the file, whichever comes first.

arguments.name: pipe_id
arguments.description: The pipe ID, as returned by pipe.open() .

name: plcm.activity.action.performed
description: Callback-function for when the activity is double-click upon.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

name: plcm.activity.deleted
description: Callback-function for when the activity is about to be deleted in the UI.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

returnValue: True, when the delete is allowed.

name: plcm.activity.moved
syntax: function boolean plcm.activity.moved (string activity.id, long start.date, long end.date)
description: Callback-function for when the activity end-date and/or start-date have been changed in the UI.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

arguments.name: start.date
arguments.description: New start date.

arguments.name: end.date
arguments.description: New end date.

returnValue: True, when the move is allowed.

name: plcm.add.activity
syntax: function long plcm.add.activity (string parent.activity.id, string activity.id, string activity.name [, long start.date] [, long end.date] [, long completion.percentage])
description: Adds a child activity to an activity. This will cause the parent activity to be displayed as a summary bar.

arguments.name: parent.activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the parent activity.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: Unique ID of the activity.

arguments.name: activity.name
arguments.description: Name for the activity.

arguments.name: start.date ]
arguments.description: Date the activity starts (utc) If a start.date is passed, end.date is mandatory.

arguments.name: end.date ]
arguments.description: Date the activity ends (utc)

arguments.name: completion.percentage ]
arguments.description: The completion percentage for the activity (0-100)

name: plcm.add.activity.marker
syntax: function long plcm.add.activity.marker (string activity.id, long icon.id, long date_time, string tooltip, string legend.id)
description: Adds a marker to an activity. The marker will be visualized by an icon.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

arguments.name: icon.id
arguments.description: Identification of a marker icon. There are 7 icons predefined. Use one of these predefined icons by specifying: PLCM_ICON_TACK PLCM_ICON_TAG PLCM_ICON_UP PLCM_ICON_BOOKMARK PLCM_ICON_PIN PLCM_ICON_STAR PLCM_ICON_CLOCK

arguments.name: date_time
arguments.description: The date and time of the marker (utc).

arguments.name: tooltip
arguments.description: Tooltip of the marker.

arguments.name: legend.id
arguments.description: ID of the legend of the marker.

name: plcm.add.activity.property
syntax: function long plcm.add.activity.property (string property.id, string property.label)
description: Adds a property to an activity. The property will be visualized as a column in the table part of the Gantt view.

arguments.name: property.id
arguments.description: ID of the property. The following property.id's are predefined. You can change the label for these predefined properties. NAME|ID|START|END|RESOURCE Adding a property with id equal to "TOOLTIP" will also add a tooltip on the activity.

arguments.name: property.label
arguments.description: Label (column header) of the property.

name: plcm.add.command
syntax: function long plcm.add.command (string command.id, string command.text [, enum ecatg] [, boolean command.checked])
description: Adds a custom command. This command will appear in the specific menu of the plan chart.

arguments.name: command.id
arguments.description: Unique ID of the command. If ID equals "SEPARATOR", a separator will be added to the specific menu. If a command with this ID has been added before, the command text will be changed.

arguments.name: command.text
arguments.description: Command text.

arguments.name: ecatg ]
arguments.description: An optional parameter for specifying the category of the command. This parameter is applicable when running in one of the following UI-modes: WEBUI_COMMONUI, HTML_UI or SOHO_XI. If this parameter is not specified while running in one of these three UI-modes, the category Actions will be used by default.

arguments.name: command.checked ]
arguments.description: An optional parameter for specifying the check mark in front of the command. Specify TRUE if you want the command to appear checked. Specify FALSE to show the command unchecked.

name: plcm.add.constraint
syntax: function long plcm.add.constraint (string activity.id.from, string activity.id.to, long constraint.type)
description: Adds a constraint between two activities.

arguments.name: activity.id.from
arguments.description: ID of the from activity.

arguments.name: activity.id.to
arguments.description: ID of the to activity.

arguments.name: constraint.type
arguments.description: CONSTRAINT_START_START | CONSTRAINT_START_END | CONSTRAINT_END_START | CONSTRAINT_END_END

name: plcm.add.reservation
syntax: function long plcm.add.reservation (string activity.id, string resource.id)
description: Assigns an activity to a resource.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity to assign.

arguments.name: resource.id
arguments.description: ID of the resource to assign the activity to.

name: plcm.add.resource
syntax: function long plcm.add.resource (string parent.resource.id, string resource.id, string resource.name [, long quantity])
description: Adds a child resource to a resource.

arguments.name: parent.resource.id
arguments.description: ID of the parent resource.

arguments.name: resource.id
arguments.description: Unique ID of the resource.

arguments.name: resource.name
arguments.description: Name for the resource.

arguments.name: quantity ]
arguments.description: Optional. Quantity

name: plcm.add.resource.property
syntax: function long plcm.add.resource.property (string property.id, string property.label)
description: Adds a property to a resource. The property will be visualized as a column in the table part of the Schedule view.

arguments.name: property.id
arguments.description: ID of the property. The following property.id's are predefined. You can change the label for these predefined properties. NAME|ID|QUANTITY

arguments.name: property.label
arguments.description: Label (column header) of the property

name: plcm.add.root.activity
syntax: function long plcm.add.root.activity (string root.activity.id, string root.activity.name)
description: Call this function only once. The root activity will serve as highest level parent for all other activities. Therefore it will be displayed as summary bar in the Gantt view.

arguments.name: root.activity.id
arguments.description: Unique ID for the activity.

arguments.name: root.activity.name
arguments.description: Name for the root activity.

name: plcm.add.root.resource
syntax: function long plcm.add.root.resource (string root.resource.id, string root.resource.name)
description: Call this function only once. The root resource will serve as highest level parent for all other resources

arguments.name: root.resource.id
arguments.description: Unique ID for the resource.

arguments.name: root.resource.name
arguments.description: Name for the root resource.

name: plcm.clear
description: Clears the plan chart in order to build up a new schedule.

name: plcm.command.performed
syntax: function long plcm.command.performed (string command.id, const long activities.context.count, const string activities.context(), const long resources.context.count, string resources.context())

arguments.description: ID of the command.

arguments.name: activities.context.count

arguments.name: activities.context()

arguments.name: resources.context.count

arguments.name: resources.context()
arguments.description: Array of resource id's that are selected in the UI.

name: plcm.constraint.deleted

arguments.name: constraint.type

returnValue: True, when the delete is allowed.

name: plcm.create.legend.entry
syntax: function long plcm.create.legend.entry (string legend.id, long color, string description)
description: Defines a legend entry. This function must be called before the plcm.start() is called. The legend will be visualized in the underneath the plan chart.

arguments.name: legend.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: One of the following constants: PLCM_RED, PLCM_LIGHTRED, PLCM_BLUE, PLCM_DARKBLUE, PLCM_GREEN, PLCM_LIGHTGREEN, PLCM_ORANGE, PLCM_YELLOW, PLCM_PURPLE, PLCM_BACKGROUND PLCM_BACKGROUND is avialable from Tools Interface Version (TIV) TIV 2140

arguments.name: description

name: plcm.delete.resource

name: plcm.get.default.availability

name: plcm.init

arguments.name: initial.types

arguments.name: options ]
arguments.description: When passing both types to the initial.types argument, the default.type argument determines which type will be default shown: STARTUP_CHART_TYPE_GANTT or STARTUP_CHART_TYPE_SCHEDULE,SHOW_COMPLETION_PERCENTAGES,EXPAND_ALL_ROWS,DELETE_NOT_ALLOWED

name: plcm.set.activity.name

NAME|ID|START|END|RESOURCE When using property.id equals "TOOLTIP", the tooltip on the activity will also change. When using property.id equals "SLACK_TOOLTIP", the tooltip of the slack for the activity will also change.

arguments.name: property.value
arguments.description: Value of the property

name: plcm.set.activity.start.date

arguments.name: activity.id

name: plcm.set.activity.unavailability
syntax: function long plcm.set.activity.unavailability (const string activity.id(), const long no.elements, const long start.date(), const long end.date(), const string description() mb, const string legend.id() mb)
description: Sets the unavailabilities of an activity. This show the bars of unavailabilities on the background of the row of the activity and provide an insight of the availability of the activity.

arguments.name: activity.id()
arguments.description: Unique ID of the referenced activity.

arguments.name: no.elements
arguments.description: Number of unavailabilities of the activity

arguments.name: start.date()
arguments.description: Array of start dates of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

arguments.name: end.date()
arguments.description: Array of end dates of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

arguments.name: description() mb
arguments.description: Array of descriptions of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

arguments.name: legend.id() mb
arguments.description: Array of legend ID�s of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

name: plcm.set.legend.for.activity
syntax: function long plcm.set.legend.for.activity (string activity.id, string legend.id)
description: Lets the complete activity refer to a legend entry. The activity will get the color of the legend.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

arguments.name: legend.id
arguments.description: ID of the legend.

name: plcm.set.legend.for.activity.division
syntax: function long plcm.set.legend.for.activity.division (string activity.id, string legend.id, long Start.percentage, long End.percentage [, long Num.decimals])
description: Lets a division of an activity refer to a legend entry. Thedivision will get the color of the legend.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

arguments.name: legend.id
arguments.description: ID of the legend.

arguments.name: Start.percentage
arguments.description: 0-99. Start of the division within the activity

arguments.name: End.percentage
arguments.description: 1-100. End of the division within the activity

arguments.name: Num.decimals ]
arguments.description: 0-6. Number of decimals (default 2) to be used in the percentage values (optional)

name: plcm.set.resource.name
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.name (string resource.id, string name)
description: Change the name of a resource.

arguments.name: resource.id
arguments.description: ID of the resource

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: New name for the resource

name: plcm.set.resource.property.value
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.property.value (string resource.id, string property.id, string property.value)
description: Sets a resource property. The property will be visualized in the table part of the Schedule view.

arguments.name: resource.id
arguments.description: ID of the resource.

arguments.name: property.id
arguments.description: ID of the property. The following property.id's are predefined, and must not be used in this function. NAME|ID|QUANTITY

arguments.name: property.value
arguments.description: Value of the property

name: plcm.set.resource.quantity
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.quantity (string resource.id, long quantity)
description: Change the quantity of a resource.

arguments.name: resource.id
arguments.description: ID of the resource

arguments.name: quantity
arguments.description: New quantity for the resource

name: plcm.set.resource.unavailability
syntax: function long plcm.set.resource.unavailability (const string resource.id(), const long no.elements, const long start.date(), const long end.date(), const string description() mb, const string legend.id() mb)
description: Sets the unavailabilities of an resource. This show the bars of unavailabilities on the background of the row of the activity and provide an insight of the availability of the resource.

arguments.name: resource.id()
arguments.description: Unique ID of the referenced resource.

arguments.name: no.elements
arguments.description: Number of unavailabilities of the resource

arguments.name: start.date()
arguments.description: Array of start dates of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

arguments.name: end.date()
arguments.description: Array of end dates of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

arguments.name: description() mb
arguments.description: Array of descriptions of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

arguments.name: legend.id() mb
arguments.description: Array of legend ID�s of the unavailability. (no.elements occurrences)

name: plcm.set.slack.for.activity
syntax: function long plcm.set.slack.for.activity (string activity.id, long start.date, long end.date, string legend.id)
description: Sets the slack attributes of an activity. The slack will get the color of the legend.

arguments.name: activity.id
arguments.description: ID of the activity.

arguments.name: start.date
arguments.description: Start date for the activity slack (utc).

arguments.name: end.date
arguments.description: End date for the activity slack (utc).

arguments.name: legend.id
arguments.description: ID of the legend for the slack.

name: plcm.start
description: Activates the plan chart,in other words it takes over control from the application. See also plcm.init() for more information.

name: pos
syntax: function long pos (string source, string part [, long offset])
description: This returns the start position of a specified substring ( part ) in a specified string ( source ). source and part can be either strings or string expressions.

arguments.name: source
arguments.description: The string to search in

arguments.name: part
arguments.description: The part to search

arguments.name: offset ]
arguments.description: Optional search starting position; when not specified the search starts at position 1. Note that: If offset <= 1 , then searching start at position 1. If offset > len(source) , then 0 is returned. This parameter can be used as of TIV 1700 .

returnValue: The start position of the substring in the string. Or 0 if the substring is not found.

name: pow
syntax: function double pow (double x, double y)
description: This computes the value of x raised to the power of y . If x is zero, y must be positive. If x is negative, y must be an integer.
returnValue: The value of x to the power of y. If y is zero, the return value is always 1.0

name: prcm.bms.is.notification
description: Tests whether the specified bms command is a notification of a subject. If no bms command is passed to this function, the predefined 4GL variable bms.sender.command is checked.

arguments.name: bms.command ]
arguments.description: Optional bms command that must be checked to see whether it represents a notification of a subject. If not specified the predefined bms.sender.command variable is checked

returnValue: This function returns TRUE if the tested bms command represents a PRCM notification. Otherwise FALSE is returned.

name: prcm.get.aspect
syntax: function observer processes can call prcm.get.aspect ()
description: Returns the last decoded aspect of the subject that did a notification.
returnValue: The last decoded aspect as string.

name: prcm.get.data
description: Returns the last data passed by the subject that did a notification.

name: prcm.get.subject
description: Returns the last decoded subject that did a notification.
returnValue: The last decoded subject as string.

name: prcm.notify
syntax: function void prcm.notify (const string subject [, string aspect(32)] [, long data])
description: Is called by a subject process to notify other processes that it has changed. Optionally, an aspect can be specified to indicate what aspect of the subject process has changed.

arguments.name: subject
arguments.description: The subject that has changed. This can be freely defined.

arguments.name: aspect(32) ]
arguments.description: Optional aspect of the subject that has changed. This can be freely defined.

arguments.name: data ]
arguments.description: Optional xml node containing data that observers might be interested in. The contents of the XML document can be freely defined. From Tools Interface Version (TIV) 2000, the XML structure is duplicated to the PRCM process. In older versions, only a reference to the XML is sent to the other processes.

name: prcm.register
syntax: function void prcm.register (const string subject [, string aspect(32)])
description: Is called by an Observer process (i.e. the current process) to register/subscribe itself for a certain Subject (and optionally Aspect). Afterwards, if the subject notifies its observers, this process will be notified by the Process Change Manager.

arguments.name: subject
arguments.description: The subject in which the current process is interested.

arguments.name: aspect(32) ]
arguments.description: Optional aspect in which the current process is interested.

name: prcm.unregister
syntax: function void prcm.unregister (const string subject [, string aspect(32)])
description: Is called by an Observer process (i.e. the current process) to unregister/unsubscribe itself for a certain Subject (and optionally Aspect). Afterwards, this process will no longer be notified by the Process Change Manager if the subject tries to notify its observers.

arguments.name: subject
arguments.description: The subject in which the current process is interested.

arguments.name: aspect(32) ]
arguments.description: Optional aspect in which the current process is interested.

name: print.const
description: This displays a specified constant string value in the current form field. The current value of the database field is not affected.

name: progress.indicator.exists
description: This checks if a progress indicator was already created.

name: pstat
syntax: function long pstat (long pid, ref string progname, ref long info(PSMAXSIZE))
description: This returns status information about a specified process.

arguments.name: pid
arguments.description: The ID of the process for which you want to retrieve information. Specify a negative value here to retrieve information about the init process.

arguments.name: progname
arguments.description: This returns the process code.

arguments.name: info(PSMAXSIZE)
arguments.description: This returns status information that you can retrieve with the following macros, each of which returns a long: ps.state(info) returns PSRUNNING, PSBLOCKING, PSSLEEPING, or PSTERMINATING. ps.group(info) returns the identifier of the process group to which the process belongs. ps.parent(info) returns the identifier of the parent process of the process group. ps.flags(info) returns flags. ps.nice(info) returns the nice value of the process. ps.cpu.use(info) returns the number of ticks used by the process. ps.mwin(info) returns the object id of the main window of the process. ps.pri(info) returns the priority of the process. ps.size(info) returns the amount of memory allocated by the process (in bytes). ps.cwin(info) returns the object id of the current window of the process. ps.menu(info) returns the object id of the menubar of the current window of the process. ps.bar(info) returns the object id of the toolbar of the current window of the process.

name: publish.check
syntax: function long publish.check (const string bus.component.name, ref long result.xml)
description: This function checks whether a destination (bus component) is available for publishing events. Note that publish.open() and publish.message() will not always report errors, but will send messages to an error handler or log file instead. To avoid publishing many message to the error handler or log file, this check function can be used before using publish.open().

arguments.name: bus.component.name
arguments.description: (input) Name of the bus component to be used.

arguments.name: result.xml
arguments.description: (output): xml containing result in case of errors or warnings; see Outbound Publishing functions overview for details. The result.xml is available if return value <> 0.

name: publish.close
syntax: function long publish.close (long publication.id, ref long result.xml)
description: This function closes a publication channel. After using this function, publish.message() and publish.error.message() cannot be used anymore unless a new publish.open() is done first.

arguments.name: publication.id
arguments.description: (input) id for publication channel, which is provided as the return value of publish.open()

arguments.name: result.xml
arguments.description: (output): xml containing result in case of errors or warnings; see Outbound Publishing functions overview for details.

name: publish.error.message
syntax: function long publish.error.message (long publication.id, long error.xml, ref long result.xml)
description: This function reports an error instead of publishing a message. It can be used if a message could not be created or sent successfully. Note that the error message is not sent to the bus component as specified in publish.open(). Instead, the Adapter configuration specifies an error handler for the bus component and the error message is sent to that error handler. If the error handler cannot be found or is unavailable, the Adapter will take care that the error is logged.

arguments.name: publication.id
arguments.description: (input) id for publication channel, which is provided as the return value of publish.open()

arguments.name: error.xml
arguments.description: (input) error message to be published, which is an xml structure according to the Result definition of the BDE standard..

arguments.name: result.xml
arguments.description: (output): xml containing errors or warnings; see Outbound Publishing functions overview for details. This only occurs if the functionality is unavailable in the current Adapter version; in all other cases the result.xml is empty.

name: publish.message
syntax: function long publish.message (long publication.id, long message.xml, ref long result.xml)
description: This function publishes the specified message.

arguments.name: publication.id
arguments.description: (input) id for publication channel, which is provided as the return value of publish.open()

arguments.name: message.xml
arguments.description: (input) message to be published, which is an xml structure.

arguments.name: result.xml
arguments.description: (output): xml containing result in case of errors or warnings; see Outbound Publishing functions overview for details.

name: publish.open
syntax: function long publish.open (const string bus.component.name, ref long result.xml)
description: This function initializes the publishing.

arguments.name: bus.component.name
arguments.description: (input) Name of the bus component to be used.

arguments.name: result.xml
arguments.description: (output): xml containing result in case of errors or warnings; see Outbound Publishing functions overview for details.

name: publish.webpart.message
syntax: function void publish.webpart.message (const string type, long fromNode [, long toNode])
description: Sends a message to the Companyon shell, where it is passed on to any webparts registered to this message type.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: The message type.

arguments.name: fromNode
arguments.description: See Handling of fromNode and toNode arguments

arguments.name: toNode ]
arguments.description: See Handling of fromNode and toNode arguments

name: put.boolean.arg
syntax: function long put.boolean.arg (long arg_no, boolean value)
description: The function put.boolean.arg() assigns the supplied boolean value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

arguments.name: arg_no
arguments.description: The sequence number of an argument supplied to the currently executing function (i.e. the function in which put.boolean.arg() is called). The allowed range for this sequence number is 1 ... get.argc() .

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to assign to the specified argument. Implicit conversion of the supplied boolean value to the type of the specified argument is performed.

name: put.double.arg
syntax: function long put.double.arg (long arg_no, double value)
description: The function put.double.arg() assigns the supplied double value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

arguments.name: arg_no
arguments.description: The sequence number of an argument supplied to the currently executing function (i.e. the function in which put.double.arg() is called). The allowed range for this sequence number is 1 ... get.argc() .

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to assign to the specified argument. Implicit conversion of the supplied double value to the type of the specified argument is performed.

name: put.indexed.var
syntax: function [long] put.indexed.var (long processno, string variable_name, void value, long dim1 [, dim2, dim3, dim4 ])

arguments.name: processno
arguments.description: The process to which the destination variable belongs. You can specify the process ID, or you can use the predefined variables pid or parent .

arguments.name: variable_name
arguments.description: The name of the external variable in the other process (this must be a lower case string).

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be assigned to the variable. Implicit conversion of the supplied value from its original type to the type of the specified variable is performed.

arguments.name: dim1 [, dim2, dim3, dim4 ]
arguments.description: Use these to specify a particular array element to which the new value is to be assigned. To assign a single variable value, set dim1 to 1 and omit the other dim arguments.

name: put.long.arg
syntax: function long put.long.arg (long arg_no, long value)
description: The function put.long.arg() assigns the supplied long value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

arguments.name: arg_no
arguments.description: The sequence number of an argument supplied to the currently executing function (i.e. the function in which put.long.arg() is called). The allowed range for this sequence number is 1 ... get.argc() .

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to assign to the specified argument. Implicit conversion of the supplied long value to the type of the specified argument is performed.

name: put.string.arg
syntax: function long put.string.arg (long arg_no, string value)
description: The function put.string.arg() assigns the supplied string value to the specified argument, after conversion to the type of the argument.

arguments.name: arg_no
arguments.description: The sequence number of an argument supplied to the currently executing function (i.e. the function in which put.string.arg() is called). The allowed range for this sequence number is 1 ... get.argc() .

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to assign to the specified argument. Implicit conversion of the supplied string value to the type of the specified argument is performed.

name: put.var
syntax: function [long] put.var (long processno, string variable_name, void value)

arguments.name: processno
arguments.description: The process to which the destination variable belongs. You can specify the process ID, or you can use the predefined variables pid or parent .

arguments.name: variable_name
arguments.description: The name of the external variable in the other process (this must be a lower case string).

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The value to be assigned to the variable. Implicit conversion of the supplied value from its original type to the type of the specified variable is performed.

name: qss.search
syntax: function long qss.search (long flag, void search, ref void array, ref long def [, long dept])
description: This searches a specified array for a particular value, which is referred to as the search key. By default, it reads the array sequentially until it finds the specified value (that is, it performs a linear search). To perform a binary search instead, you must first sort the data, for example with qss.sort() and then call qss.search() with the flag argument set to QSS.SRC.IS.SORTED. If the same search key occurs more than once, then you should also specify the QSS.SRC.DUPL.ALLOWED option, or else it is not predictable which one of the duplicate records is found.

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: This specifies which array element is to be retrieved and the type of search to be performed. You can set the argument to one of the following possible values: QSS.FIRST Find the first record in the array; the search argument is ignored.

name: qss.sort
syntax: function long qss.sort (ref void array, ref long def [, long dept])
description: This function performs a fast sort of a specified array.

arguments.name: array
arguments.description: The name of the array to be sorted.

arguments.name: def
arguments.description: This determines how the array is to be sorted. The argument must be declared as follows: long def(x,4) | x is the number of sort fields You can define several sort fields (1 to x ). When performing a sort, the system sorts on the first sort field. Then, if there are duplicate values in the first sort field, the system sorts on the second sort field, and so on. For each sort field, you define the four sort properties by using the following functions. In each case, the field_number argument specifies the sequence number (1 to x ) of the sort field. void qss.start( ref long def, long field_number, long position ) This specifies the start position of the sort field in the array elements.

name: query.define.sort.order
syntax: function long query.define.sort.order (long table.index, const string field.var, direction.var [, const string ..., ...])
description: With this function the direction of an index-field or the whole index of an table-index can be set.

arguments.name: table.index
arguments.description: Sequence number of the referenced table-index.

arguments.name: field.var, direction.var
arguments.description: field order direction set For each set, specify the order direction with the name of the relevant field and it's direction of sorting field.var: 1) Field must exist in the table index by parameter table.index or 2) the whole of the referenced table-index with name: file _index< number > field.var equals indexname cannot combined with another field.var. direction.var: Presentation direction, possible values direction "ASC" or "DESC".
next pair of [field.var, direction.var]. Use these optional pair of arguments to pass one or more arguments to the specified function. Use commas (,) to separate the arguments.

name: query.extend.fld.from
syntax: function long query.extend.fld.from (string select_column, string extension_string)
description: With the query.extend.fld� interface the metadata is stored in the 4gl engine. The query.extend.fld� information is used to build the standard query for retrieving requested data, inclusive the application fields. The result is used for the display of the field. The value of easy filter on the application field and the query.extend.fld� information is used to extend the WHERE clause of the standard query. The standard query is used to display the session.

arguments.name: select_column
arguments.description: Name of the form field in the form.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the names of the tables to be included in the FROM statement. Use commas [,] to separate the table names.

name: query.extend.fld.select
syntax: function long query.extend.fld.select (string select_column, string select_expression)
description: With the query.extend.fld� interface the metadata is stored in the 4gl engine. The query.extend.fld� information is used to build the standard query for retrieving requested data, inclusive the application fields. The result is used for the display of the field. The value of easy filter on the application field and the query.extend.fld� information is used to extend the WHERE clause of the standard query. The standard query is used to display the session.

arguments.name: select_column
arguments.description: Name of the form field in the form.

arguments.name: select_expression
arguments.description: SQL instruction for SELECT clause.

name: query.extend.fld.where
syntax: function long query.extend.fld.where (string select_column, string where_condition)
description: With the query.extend.fld� interface the metadata is stored in the 4gl engine. The query.extend.fld� information is used to build the standard query for retrieving requested data, inclusive the application fields. The result is used for the display of the field. The value of easy filter on the application field and the query.extend.fld� information is used to extend the WHERE clause of the standard query. The standard query is used to display the session.

arguments.name: select_column
arguments.description: Name of the form field in the form.

arguments.name: where_condition
arguments.description: SQL instruction for WHERE clause.

name: query.extend.from
syntax: function void query.extend.from (string extension_string [, long mode])
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the FROM clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.from.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the names of the tables to be included in the FROM statement. Use commas [,] to separate the table names.

arguments.name: mode ]
arguments.description: This optional argument can have one of the following values: EXTEND_OVERWRITE replaces any existing query extension (this is the default mode)

name: query.extend.from.in.zoom
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the FROM clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.from() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the names of the tables to be included in the FROM statement. Use commas [,] to separate the tables names.

name: query.extend.hint
syntax: function void query.extend.hint (string extension_string [, long mode])
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the HINT clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.hint.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the hints to be included in the HINT statement.

arguments.name: mode ]
arguments.description: This optional argument can have one of the following values: EXTEND_OVERWRITE replaces any existing query extension (this is the default mode)

name: query.extend.hint.in.zoom
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the HINT clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.hint() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the hint to be included in the HINT statement.

name: query.extend.select
syntax: function void query.extend.select (string extension_string [, long mode])
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the SELECT clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.select.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the names of the fields to be included in the SELECT statement. Use commas [,] to separate the field names.

arguments.name: mode ]
arguments.description: This optional argument can have one of the following values: EXTEND_OVERWRITE replaces any existing query extension (this is the default mode)

name: query.extend.select.in.zoom
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the SELECT clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.select() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing the names of the fields to be included in the SELECT statement. Use commas [,] to separate the field names.

name: query.extend.where
syntax: function void query.extend.where (string extension_string [, long mode])
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the WHERE clause of a database query. Use this function for non-zoom sessions. Use query.extend.where.in.zoom() for defining query filters for zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing conditions to be included in the WHERE statement.

arguments.name: mode ]
arguments.description: This optional argument can have one of the following values: EXTEND_OVERWRITE replaces any existing query extension (this is the default mode)

name: query.extend.where.in.zoom
description: Use this to construct a query extension for the WHERE clause of a database query. Use this function for zoom sessions. Use query.extend.where() for defining query filters in non-zoom sessions.

arguments.name: extension_string
arguments.description: A string containing conditions to be included in the WHERE statement.

name: query.object
syntax: function long query.object (long object_id, long attribute_in, void value_in, long size_iin, long attribute_in, ref void value_out, ref long size_out)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: object_id
arguments.description: The ID of the object to be queried, as returned by create.object() when the object was created.

arguments.name: attribute_in
arguments.description: You can use one or more sets of these arguments to specify the input attributes for the query. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, DsNcolumns), and the attribute value. For attributes of type void data or long array, you must also include the size of the data or array.

arguments.name: attribute_in
arguments.description: You can use one or more sets of these arguments to specify the output of the query. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type (for example, DsNcontrol). The function returns the current value of the attribute. For attributes of type void data or long array, it also returns the size of the data or array.

name: query.sub.object
syntax: function long query.sub.object (long object_id, long sub_object_id, long attribute_in, value_in, size_in, void value_in, long size_in, long attribute_in, ref void value_out, ref long size_out)
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

arguments.name: object_id
arguments.description: The ID of the object to which the subobject belongs.

arguments.name: sub_object_id
arguments.description: The ID of the subobject within the specified object.

arguments.name: attribute_in, value_in, size_in
arguments.description: You can use one or more sets of these arguments to specify the input attributes for the query. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type and the attribute value. For attributes of type void data or long array, you must also include the size of the data or array.

arguments.name: attribute_in
arguments.description: You can use one or more sets of these arguments to specify the output of the query. For each attribute you specify, you must include the attribute type. The function returns the current value of the attribute. For attributes of type void data or long array, it also returns the size of the data or array.

name: quoted.string
description: quoted.string() assures that the contents of the variable can be used as a string for the query processor. If the string_expr contains a quote or double quote, the query processor will generate an error. This function inserts the necessary escapes for the string.

name: raise.object
description: Deprecated. This function is only supported for Baan Windows and its usage is therefore deprecated.

name: random
description: This function uses a system-independent random number generator. On all systems, the generator will generate the same random numbers, provided that the same seed is supplied.

name: rbhp.get.parameter
description: This function returns the named drillback parameter value which was passed by the Role Based Home Page drillback URL. This function can be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back(). This function can also be called from a 4GL session when it was started from a Role Based Home Page drillback.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The name of the parameter for which the value is requested. For example LogicalId. These names are case sensitive !

returnValue: The value of the named parameter or an empty string when this parameter was not present.

name: rbhp.query.extend.from
description: Set the FROM clause extension to be used when starting the session. No syntax checking on the passed extension will be done. This extension will be appended to the extension set by the session. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

arguments.name: from.extension
arguments.description: A string containing FROM clause extension.

name: rbhp.query.extend.select
description: Set the SELECT clause extension to be used when starting the session. No syntax checking on the passed extension will be done. This extension will be appended to the extension set by the session. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

arguments.name: select.extension
arguments.description: A string containing SELECT clause extension.

name: rbhp.query.extend.where
description: Set the WHERE clause extension to be used when starting the session. No syntax checking on the passed extension will be done. This extension will be appended to the extension set by the session. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

arguments.name: where.extension
arguments.description: A string containing WHERE clause extension.

name: rbhp.set.error.message
description: Set error message and/or error code to be reported to the end user when during the tcint.dll0001.drill.back() function an error occurred. This function can only be called from the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back().

arguments.name: mess.or.code
arguments.description: Specifies either the data dictionary code for the message or a literal string. In the latter case, the value of mess.or.code must start with the at sign [@]. Note that using a literal string makes the script language dependent.

arguments.name: arg ... ]
arguments.description: The literal string or message specified with mess.or.code can contain format characters for parameter substitution. The values which must be substituted are specified in the 2nd, 3rd, ... arguments of the function. The number of these arguments is variable. For details about formatting a string see the sprintf$() .

name: rbhp.set.session
description: Set the session to be started, the mode of this session, the company number in which this session and the start index of the session. This function can only be called by either the application function: tcint.dll0001.drill.back() or the tools function icm.drillback() of the tticmdll0002 library.

arguments.name: session.code
arguments.description: The code of the session that must be started

arguments.name: mode
arguments.description: SINGLE_OCC The session is started as a single-occurrence (details) session. MULTI_OCC The session is started as a multi occurrence (overview) session. MULTI_OCC+MODAL The session is started as a multi occurrence in zoom mode.

arguments.name: company
arguments.description: The company number in which the session must be started.

arguments.name: session.index ]
arguments.description: Optional argument specifying the initial index of the started session.

name: rdi.audit.hosts
syntax: function long rdi.audit.hosts (string table_name(9), long comp_nr, ref string hosts())
description: This returns the names of the hosts on which audit information for a particular table is stored.

arguments.name: table_name(9)
arguments.description: The name of the table.

arguments.name: comp_nr
arguments.description: The company number of the table.

arguments.name: hosts()
arguments.description: This returns a string containing the names of all hosts on which audit information for the specified table is stored. The host names are separated by commas [,]. The local host is referred to as 'localhost'.

name: rdi.column
syntax: function long rdi.column (string column_name(18), ref string domain_name(14), ref long offset, ref long size, ref long dept, ref long type, ref long flag, ref string default_value(.))
description: This returns information about a specified table column.

arguments.name: column_name(18)
arguments.description: The name of the column about which you want to retrieve information.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: This returns the name of the column's domain.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: This returns the position of the column in the row.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: This returns the size of the column, in bytes. See this list of database types and related byte counts .

arguments.name: dept
arguments.description: This returns the depth of the column (array columns only).

arguments.name: type
arguments.description: This returns the database type of the column. For example, DB.LONG, DB.FLOAT, and so on. See this list of database types .

arguments.name: flag
arguments.description: This returns a bit pattern that represents one or more of the following values: DB.ARRAY DB.CDF DB.CHILD DB.FILLED

arguments.name: default_value(.)
arguments.description: This returns the default value of the column.

name: rdi.column.combined
syntax: function long rdi.column.combined (string column_name(18), string ref child_colums(18, 32))
description: This returns information about the child columns of a specified column.

arguments.name: column_name(18)
arguments.description: The name of the column for which you wish to retrieve information.

arguments.name: ref child_colums(18, 32)
arguments.description: This returns an array containing the names of the child columns of the specified column. It can contain the names of up to 32 child columns.

returnValue: The function returns the number of filled children.

name: rdi.ctoe
syntax: function long rdi.ctoe (string domain_name(14), string enum_name)
description: This gets an enum as string and returns the enum-value as long belonging to it in the specified domain.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: enum_name
arguments.description: A string representing an enum-value in the domain.

name: rdi.date.input.format$
syntax: function string rdi.date.input.format$ (string date_format(7) [, ref string display_format()])
description: This returns the input format defined in the data dictionary for a specified date format. The input format can be any combination of day-in-week (D), week-in-year (W), and year (Y), or any combination of day-in-month (D), month-in-year (M), and year (Y). For example, if the function returns MDY, the input format on a form field must be month, day-in-month, and year (for example, 12311998).

arguments.name: date_format(7)
arguments.description: A date format defined in the data dictionary. This must be specified as %D n [, lang ], where n is the date format code and lang is the language code. See sprintf$()sprintf.

arguments.name: display_format() ]
arguments.description: Optional argument which returns the display format for the specified date format.

returnValue: The input format defined in the data dictionary for the specified date format.

name: rdi.domain
syntax: function long rdi.domain (string domain_name(14), ref string oformat(.), ref string lechar(.), ref string ilchar(.), ref long adjust, ref string errmess(.), ref long range_expr_id [, ref long plen] [, ref string iformat(.)])
description: This returns information about a specified domain.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain for which you want to retrieve information.

arguments.name: oformat(.)
arguments.description: This returns the output format of the domain.

arguments.name: lechar(.)
arguments.description: This returns the legal characters for the domain.

arguments.name: ilchar(.)
arguments.description: This returns the illegal characters for the domain.

arguments.name: adjust
arguments.description: This returns the domain's alignment mode. Possible values are: RDI.NONE RDI.LEFT RDI.RIGHT RDI.CENTER

arguments.name: errmess(.)
arguments.description: This returns the domain's error message.

arguments.name: range_expr_id
arguments.description: This returns the ID of the compiled expression for the range check.

arguments.name: plen ]
arguments.description: This returns the maximum field length (in display width) used on forms and reports.

arguments.name: iformat(.) ]
arguments.description: This returns the domain's internal format.

returnValue: The function returns the domain type, or -1 if an errors occurs. The possible domain types are:

name: rdi.domain.byte
syntax: function long rdi.domain.byte (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.BYTE.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits defined for the byte-type domain.

name: rdi.domain.combined
syntax: function long rdi.domain.combined (string domain_name(14), ref string child_domains(14, 32))
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.COMBINED.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: child_domains(14, 32)
arguments.description: This returns an array containing the names of the children of the specified domain. It can contain the names of up to 32 children.

name: rdi.domain.date
syntax: function long rdi.domain.date (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.DATE.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits defined for the date-type domain.

name: rdi.domain.double
syntax: function long rdi.domain.double (string domain_name(14), ref long digits_before, ref long digits_after, ref long divide_factor, ref long round_code)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.DOUBLE.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits_before
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits before the decimal point in the specified domain.

arguments.name: digits_after
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits after the decimal point.

arguments.name: divide_factor
arguments.description: This returns the divide factor for the specified domain.

arguments.name: round_code
arguments.description: This returns the rounding mode for the specified domain. Possible values are: 0 truncate (for example, both 1.5 and 1.49 are rounded down to 1) 1 normal round (for example, 1.5 is rounded up to 2; 1.49 is rounded down to 1) 2 round up (for example, both 1.5 and 1.49 are rounded up to 2)

name: rdi.domain.enum
syntax: function long rdi.domain.enum (string domain_name(14), ref long no_enum_items)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.ENUM.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: no_enum_items
arguments.description: The number of enum items in the specified domain.

name: rdi.domain.enum.value
syntax: function long rdi.domain.enum.value (string domain_name, long enum_item, string language, ref string keyword(.), ref string descr(.), ref long value)
description: This returns information about a specified item in an enumerated domain.

arguments.name: domain_name
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: enum_item
arguments.description: The position of the enum item for which you want to retrieve information.

arguments.name: language
arguments.description: The language code for the enumerated domain.

arguments.name: keyword(.)
arguments.description: This returns the constant name of the specified enum item.

arguments.name: descr(.)
arguments.description: This returns the description of the specified enum item.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: This returns the constant value of the specified enum item.

name: rdi.domain.float
syntax: function long rdi.domain.float (string domain_name(14), ref long digits_before, ref long digits_after, ref long divide_factor, ref long round_code)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.FLOAT.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits_before
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits before the decimal point in the specified domain.

arguments.name: digits_after
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits after the decimal point.

arguments.name: divide_factor
arguments.description: This returns the divide factor for the specified domain.

arguments.name: round_code
arguments.description: This returns the rounding mode for the specified domain. Possible values are: 0 truncate (for example, both 1.5 and 1.49 are rounded down to 1) 1 normal round (for example, 1.5 is rounded up to 2; 1.49 is rounded down to 1) 2 round up (for example, both 1.5 and 1.49 are rounded up to 2)

name: rdi.domain.integer
syntax: function long rdi.domain.integer (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.INTEGER.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits defined for the integer-type domain.

name: rdi.domain.long
syntax: function long rdi.domain.long (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.LONG.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits defined for the long-type domain.

name: rdi.domain.raw
syntax: function long rdi.domain.raw (string domain_name(14), ref long length)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.RAW.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: This returns the defined length of the raw string (in bytes).

name: rdi.domain.set
syntax: function long rdi.domain.set (string domain_name(14), ref long no_enum_items)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.BITSET.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: no_enum_items
arguments.description: The number of set items in the specified domain.

name: rdi.domain.set.value
syntax: function long rdi.domain.set.value (string domain_name(14), long enum_item, string language, ref string keyword(.), string descr(.), ref string value)
description: This returns information about a specified item in a set-type domain.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: enum_item
arguments.description: The numeric code of the set item for which you want to retrieve information.

arguments.name: language
arguments.description: The language code for the set domain.

arguments.name: keyword(.)
arguments.description: This returns the name of the specified set item.

arguments.name: descr(.)
arguments.description: This returns the description of the specified set item.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: This returns the value of the specified set item.

name: rdi.domain.string
syntax: function long rdi.domain.string (string domain_name(14), ref long length, ref long convert)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.STRING.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: length
arguments.description: This returns the defined length of the string (in bytes).

arguments.name: convert
arguments.description: This returns the conversion mode of the domain. Possible values are: RDI.UPPER RDI.LOWER RDI.NONE

name: rdi.domain.text
syntax: function long rdi.domain.text (string domain_name(14), ref long digits)
description: This returns information about a domain of type DB.TEXT.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: digits
arguments.description: This returns the number of digits defined for the text-type domain.

name: rdi.etoc$
syntax: function string rdi.etoc$ (string domain_name(14), long enum_value as long)
description: This gets an enum-value as long and returns a string representing it in the specified domain.

arguments.name: domain_name(14)
arguments.description: The name of the domain.

arguments.name: enum_value as long
arguments.description: An enum-value in the specified domain.

name: rdi.first.day.of.week
description: This function returns the first day of the week as defined for the company of the user. The returned number is relative to Sunday (=1). So, for example, if the function returns 2, this indicates that Monday is the user's first day of the week.
returnValue: The user's first day of the week.

name: rdi.format.digits
syntax: function long rdi.format.digits (string format(), ref long digits.before, ref long digits.after [, ref string display.format()])
description: This returns information about a specified format.

arguments.name: format()
arguments.description: The format code of a double or float.

arguments.name: digits.before
arguments.description: Number of digits before the decimal point

arguments.name: digits.after
arguments.description: Number of digits after the decimal point

arguments.name: display.format() ]
arguments.description: Optional argument where the display format is stored

name: rdi.index
syntax: function long rdi.index (string table_name(9), long index_no, ref long parts(32, 3), ref boolean duplicate, ref boolean active)
description: This returns information about a specified index.

arguments.name: table_name(9)
arguments.description: The name of the relevant table (omit the leading 't').

arguments.name: index_no
arguments.description: The index ID.

arguments.name: parts(32, 3)
arguments.description: This returns the start position, length, and type of the index parts (up to a maximum of 32 parts): parts(i,1) Start position of part i in record parts(i,2) Length of part i . See this list of database types and related byte counts . parts(i,3) Type of part i . See this list of database types .

arguments.name: duplicate
arguments.description: Indicates whether or not duplicate values are permitted. Possible values are: TRUE duplicates permitted FALSE duplicates not permitted

arguments.name: active
arguments.description: Indicates whether or not the index is active. Possible values are: TRUE index is active FALSE index is not active

name: rdi.is.application.column
syntax: function boolean rdi.is.application.column (const string column.name [, long column.type] [, long column.offset] [, long table.real.length])
description: This function checks whether the given column is an application column, or one that is automatically added by tools.

arguments.name: column.name
arguments.description: The column (including table name) to check.

arguments.name: column.type ]
arguments.description: Optional input, the column's database type as returned by e.g. rdi.column() .

arguments.name: column.offset ]
arguments.description: Optional input, the column's offset in the record as returned by e.g. rdi.column() .

arguments.name: table.real.length ]
arguments.description: Optional input, the table record's length without internal data as returned by rdi.table() (real_length).

returnValue: True if the column is a regular application column, false if the column is one that is automatically added by tools.

name: rdi.reference
syntax: function long rdi.reference (string column_name(18), ref string ref_column(18), ref long ref_mode, ref string ref_mess() [, ref boolean check_by_db] [, ref long ref_update_mode] [, ref long ref_delete_mode])
description: If a database column references a column in another table, use this function to retrieve information about the referenced column.

arguments.name: column_name(18)
arguments.description: The name of the column which references the column about which you want to retrieve information.

arguments.name: ref_column(18)
arguments.description: This returns the name of the column to which the column specified in column_name refers.

arguments.name: ref_mode
arguments.description: This returns the relation type. Possible values are: 1 mandatory 2 mandatory unless empty 3 not mandatory

arguments.name: ref_mess()
arguments.description: This returns the error message of the referenced column.

arguments.name: check_by_db ]
